page.title: 01Henham
page.content: Henham is a very pleasant village in the NW corner of Essex.Lying 40 miles north of London and 7 miles from the Hertfordshire border Henham is close to the main communication systems.The main London to Cambridge railway has a station 2 miles away at Elsenham where there is also a junction onto the M11. At the 1981 census Henham had a population of 1214 and Ugley,its neighbouring village part of which falls in our 12sq.km.area,one of 349. Henham is surrounded by fairly good quality arable farm land.The 12sq.km.block we have studied had 90% approx.farmland.Henham is a village with a high commuter element.The village has many attractive thatched and pargetted cottages,a fine church and a delightful centre with charming duck ponds.In summer it is one of the most beautiful villages in NW Essex.
